NEWS BITES

Lack Of Interest in Large Hong Kong Plot Fuels Fears A large residential plot in Hong Kong is garnering less attention than expected, signaling that protests in the city are cooling the market. The plot, which is located next to the Wong Chuk Hang transit station, is asking for an investment of HK$11.8 billion (US$1.5 billion), and it received only six bids, despite 38 groups having signaled interest earlier in the year. Among those bidding were Sun Hung Kai Properties, CK Asset Holdings and Henderson Land Development. South China Morning Post

Customer Service Can Sink a U.K. Deal Sufficient information and strong customer service are major factors with those looking to build a new home in the U.K. Research from the firm Classic Folios shows that 94% of people say customer service is important and 83% say the lack of it could cause them to not move through with a purchase. Meanwhile, 63% say buying a home is worth the effort when there is good and honest communication and they’re kept up to date with all the information that they need. PropertyWire

Former California Home of Tom Petty Listed for $5 Million Late musician Tom Petty’s former home in Encino, California, is now listed for $4.995 million. The one-acre property was built in 1989 and is 11,500 square feet with six bedrooms. The current owner is Randy Spendlove, who is the president of motion picture music at Paramount Pictures and a Grammy winner. The home also has a recording studio, a vocal booth, a wine cellar and a two-story great room. Los Angeles Times

Melbourne Prices Make Rapid Recovery Home prices in Melbourne have turned around at a rapid rate, after a recovery from the property downturn that began in June. Prices in Melbourne have grown by 4.1% in three months and have exceeded the recovery pace of Sydney. Domain
